result.execSummary:
The defendant Asia Denise Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).
  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case re-called to clarify the sentence.

As to Count 1- The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 18 days credit CONCURRENT to count 2, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

As to Count 2- The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 18 days credit CONCURRENT to count 1, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence in counts 1 & 2 and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.

Defendant Asia Denise Butler in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 18 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  Court allows for transfer to Georgia.

  Conditions of Probation:
- Mental Health unit probation supervision.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
PSI received and filed, copy forwarded to all parties.

Attorney Darryl Smith for Gregory A. Renden in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled. For reasons stated on the record.  The court removed the order for blood draw prior to release.

Court ordered the Defendant to cooperate with the SAIL Program and comply with any medication recomendations provided by a doctor.
Court orders Defendant to submit to a blood draw, and upon completion of the blood draw, Court orders a $500.00 Cash bail converted to a Signature Bond. All other previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Asia Denise Butler in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Asia Denise Butler in custody.  Irene Parthum for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to both Counts 1 and 2 and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Court Orders PSI report with recommendations.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Asia Denise Butler
Current: 2456 W. Fond du Lac Ave #10, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 04-07-2015)
Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233

Defendant Asia Denise Butler in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense contacted the Court requesting that Bail Review scheduled for 4/7/15 at 8:30 be converted to a Plea and Sentencing date. Court and District Attorney do not object IF COURT CALENDAR ALLOWS.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Asia Denise Butler in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Asia Denise Butler in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
